pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: :v: Espio231 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
I was thinking if this should go into `RingTheory/Finiteness` instead.

> I was thinking if this should go into `RingTheory/Finiteness` instead.

Good point, I think this is a better home for the result. I won't insist but I will encourage @Espio231 to move the result there. I think imports might need tweaking (but in a harmless way).
I'm not sure how this procedure works, should I add the `awaiting-review` tag again now that I've made extra changes?

@ocfnash or @erdOne can you confirm that you're not worried about the new import?

@Espio231 I think that you can just wait for Oliver or Andrew to confirm that the import is OK and then you can go ahead and r+ , assuming mathlib still compiles. I'm always slightly nervous about adding imports because right now the culture is to try and streamline the import tree as much as possible.

The new import transitively adds the new imports `Mathlib.Algebra.GeomSum` and `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.ToLin` to `Mathlib.RingTheory.Finiteness`.

Even though this is not quite as "harmless" as I was expecting, and I cannot easily quantify exactly how much this affects our import entanglement, build parallelism etc, it is obviously not disastrous so I'm declaring this is OK.

Thanks again!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8604687118/job/23579329823)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8604687118/job/23579329207)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8604687118/job/23579329657)

Thanks, this is a really useful result.

bors d+

```suggestion
theorem isNilpotent_iff_of_Finite {R M : Type*} [CommRing R] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M]
    [Module.Finite R M] {f : M [R] M} :
    IsNilpotent f   m : M,  n : , (f^n) m = 0 := by
```
Thanks for the contribution! I think the arguments should be implicit instead. And maybe incorporate `Module.End` into the name?
would `Module.End.isNilpotent_iff_of_Finite` be an appropriate name? It seems that it should be to me, since this statement is about the nilpotency of an endomorphism as you point out.
Sounds good. Though I think `Finite` should be lowercase according to the naming convention.

These are just nitpicks really:
```suggestion
theorem Module.End.isNilpotent_iff_of_finite {R M : Type*} [CommSemiring R] [AddCommMonoid M]
    [Module R M] [Module.Finite R M] {f : End R M} :
    IsNilpotent f   m : M,  n : , (f ^ n) m = 0 := by
  refine fun n, hn m  n, by simp [hn], fun h  ?_
  rcases Module.Finite.out (R := R) (M := M) with S, hS
  choose g hg using h
  use Finset.sup S g
  ext m
  have hm : m  Submodule.span R S := by simp [hS]
  induction hm using Submodule.span_induction'
   next x hx => exact LinearMap.pow_map_zero_of_le (Finset.le_sup hx) (hg x)
   simp
   simp_all
   simp_all
```
Feel free to hit the "Resolve conversation" button if you are confident you have addressed a reviewer's suggestion.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Noetherian): characterise nilpotent endomorphisms of finitely-generated modules
